moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. d3 d6 4. Nd5 Be6: Up until this point, it's been a pretty standard start to the game. It is worth noting that it causes me anxiety to move the c or f pawns out so early in the game because it makes me feel exposed, so now it seems as if there's more paths open to me.
moves.6... Be7 7. g4 O-O 8. g5 Nxd5 9. exd5 Bx: Exchange of knights didn't go too well for white.
moves.11. Nh3 Bh4+ 12. Nf2 Bg5 13. Rg1 Qf6: I don't know why I did this. If White tried to take my bishop with his bishop, he'd have the advantage because the rook basically guarantees my queen can't recapture.
I see here White is aiming for the g7 space to try and trap my king.
moves.18... Bf6 19. Qd2 d4 20. c4 Bf5 21. Bh3: Trying to trade bishops because that bishop is causing me trouble in this position.
moves.21... Bg6 22. Rg4 Nd8 23. Kc2 Ne6 24. f4: Taking another pawn. My pawn can recapture either the queen or rook if white tries to take the knight.
moves.25. Bf1 Nxd3: I don't remember why I did this move.
moves.26... e4: And with this move, I get his rook in about two turns.
moves.27. Bxe4: There's no way here White can avoid losing something.
moves.27... d3+ 28. Bxd3 Bxa1 29. Bxg6: White decides to trade bishops even though he's behind.
moves.29... fxg6 30. Re4 Qa3 31. Kb1 Bf6: The queen is making it impossible to be able to move in on the king at this point, so moving the bishop back to safety.
moves.32. b4: I think White is trying to limit my queen's movements here.
moves.32... Qa6 33. Ng4 Rae8: Trying to trade rooks at this point
moves.34. Qd5+ Kh8: I got a little scared at this point because my king was basically cornered. Luckily, I recognized that possibility but my double rooks on the back rank protected the only opening to my king.
moves.35. Nxf6: White's trying to make me move the rook (probably forgot about the pawn)
moves.36. Bg5 Qf1+ 37. Bc1: This was basically the only thing White could have done without losing another piece
moves.37... c6: Trying to scare away the queen
moves.38. Qd3: Not the best move on White's part. Now I  get a free queen.
moves.38... Qxd3+ 39. Kb2 Rxe4:
Taking the rook. White resigns. 

Conclusion: I think this was simply a case of maybe me having more experience than white. I was able to predict further into the game and use my pieces more creatively.
